arts.ttl: Dave Edwards names the one Wolves player who must start against Leeds United
arts.sum: Wolves face Leeds United on Saturday afternoon, and Vitor Pereira could have some selection headaches, but Molineux legend Dave Edwards believes one player should definitely start. Dave Edwards has said that Vitor Pereira must start Ladislav Krejci when Wolves host Leeds United on Saturday.

arts.ttl: Expert baffled at Leeds’ £15M decision vs Wolves
arts.sum: Leeds United spent close to £100million this summer, with a chunk of it going to the defence and the midfield. The lack of investment in attacking areas seems to have angered fans over the past few weeks. arts.ttl: Daniel Farke has already explained why he made ‘expensive’ decision vs Wolves
arts.sum: Daniel Farke has made the bold decision to keep Brenden Aaronson in the Leeds United lineup to face Wolves. The Whites will be looking to end their poor away form at the Molineux. Vitor Pereira’s side will also be hoping to put their first points of the season on the board. arts.ttl: One thing has caught Vitor Pereira's eye in Wolves training ahead of Leeds United
arts.sum: If Wolves can harness the spirit and work ethic Pereira has seen in training, there is genuine hope that their fortunes can be turned around, starting with a positive result against Leeds. With pressure mounting after a nightmare start to the season, Pereira has been focused on turning things around on the training ground.

arts.ttl: Chris Sutton picks a clear winner out of Wolves and Leeds United after ‘odd’ Vitor Pereira decision
arts.sum: The 52-year-old has predicted, via the BBC, that the Old Gold will secure a 1-0 win at Molineux saying, “Wolves are without the injured Jorgen Strand Larsen up front, which is a blow, but I am still backing them to win this one – maybe a new contract for Pereira will mean a new dawn for his team?” Chris Sutton has given his verdict for Wolves vs Leeds, and foresees only one winner amid a decision in he labels as ‘odd’.

arts.ttl: Daniel Farke set to make huge call for lineup vs Wolves
arts.sum: Leeds United will be hoping they can get their campaign on track after the Fulham result. The loss in London has lead to a lot of noise within the Whites’ fanbase in the past few days. That is because the Whites are winless since the Everton game at the start of the season.
